intro: Rauvolfia parvifolia var. tomentella, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed snakeroot, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been studied for potential pharmaceutical applications.
